content.description: There is no specific crux. It is some fun stemming up large jugs.
content.location: This is far inside corner to the right of pantry right.

content.description: This climb is a combination of crack, chimney, and overhang climbing. Although it is 5.6 it will test your endurance.  End the climb on a ledge near the top of small tower.
content.protection: To set up a top rope, you can lead the West face(short 15 foot scramble). Then use some cams, mostly larger, with a 25 foot piece of perlon, and you can whack three climbs on one anchor. Nice lead: bring a rack!

content.description:
Speed route, evenly spaced ledges and cracks.

 (Originally submitted anonymously, this appears to be the route just left of "K2" and "Special K". Â "Skil Brum" is the peak just to the west of "K2" in the Karakorum. - DH, 2020)
content.protection: Standard rack for lead.  Top rope is tricky, either set top rope from lower ledge or lead east side of small tower for better rope position and anchor.

content.description:
(A variation of Pantry Shelf.) 

  Pull up into the narrow dihedral to start.  This is awkward.  Above, crawl up through the chimney, and finish either ducking under the chockstone to the right or moving left to climb directly over it.
content.location: The dihedral at the left edge of the Pantry Shelf slab.

content.description: The bottom of the route is has small holds and foot chips. It is delicate.
content.protection: There is plenty of area to place a top rope. I don't remember much of any pro on the slab.
content.location: The route is to the right of Pantry shelf. Start on the right edge of the the slab. Continue up staying to the right. At the bulge veer right and continue to top.

content.description: step up to sloping shelf on bottom part of wall(crux)then continue straight up the overhanging slab near right corner.fun route for a shady spot.
content.protection: standard racksmall to medium nuts and or cams20 feet of webbing for toprope

content.description: Easy climbing up broken rock with multiple vertical cracks. As the name suggests, pick any crack to the right of Bread Board and go. This is a named route in the Knower book and is #25 in Swartling/Mayer.
content.location: Right-most route in the Pantry area. 5 to 10 feet right of Bread Board.

content.description: A fun sequence of jugs and steps.
content.protection: No much, for the lead.  Easily TR'd, of course.
There is plenty of places to put pro.
content.location: The route is to the right of unnamed 5.1 and to the left of pantry corner. Climb either of the two cracks.

content.description: This route starts rather high for short people, just lieback the corner to the first face hold, then more or less straight up the face from there.  Little holds,and rather long reaches make it 5.9.
content.protection: Lead east facing block 5.2 for a toprope anchorthe climb is south on the block25ft perlon,and 1-2-3-3.5 cams for topropeshort lead small nuts and one or two camsdepends on confidence.

content.description: This is thin face climb. There are few holds. The key is to not use the holds for pantry corner or bread board.
content.location: The face to the right of pantry corner.

content.description:
This climb is the flat face to the right of Pantry Right, Pantry Shelf, Pantry Corner. 

  Climb the center of the face and don't use the corners 

  Flat face climb that is very fun. Big long balancing and reaching move and execellent climb on the west bluff.

pathTokens: West Bluff 02 - Misery Rocks & The Pantry

content.description: The Pantry is located on the south side of Misery Gully and just down the slope from Misery Rocks.  The formation contains two dozen moderate climbs spread out over a number of different rocks.  If you arrive at the Misery Rocks area and find a crowd, check out The Pantry.  You're sure to find a nice climb and less people.
